comments.commentBody: Great way to decimate the future of our country.  There is so much waste in the military alone that could fund full education in this country for years.  Every state has lots of fat and pork in it's budget...lots of positions filled by ex-pols who got termed out and now have "no see um " jobs.  It is a huge mistake to underfund education.  Time to bust all the unions, increase the school year days and the school day itself, segregate male and female students and have school uniforms as mandatory attire.  Wow, what a change that would make.  Might some day even rival Japan for educational excellence.

A large part of the general public demands the kind of garbage dredged up by Ms. Brooks and her employees, so any suggestions she now be hunted down for providing what is in her job description and, belatedly, develop  a conscience in such matters, can be dismissed as wildly illogical. And, perhaps, we should all suspend judgment whenever front-line politicians appear to be jostling for the first stone on moral issues.

A major problem with pursuing this case is that the accuser has given at least three different stories about the event. And the story in today's NYT about the tale told to the rape counselor at the hospital provides what could be the best piece for the defense: The bloody bed sheet, not previously mentioned.

The accuser told the counselor that she saw bloody bed sheets in the room and that it wasn't her blood. Whose blood was it? Is it evidence of DSK having rough sex the night before his alleged encounter with the maid? Might there not have been seminal fluid on the sheet as well as blood? Is it possible that the maid, seeing the fluid said, "This is my lucky day" and used that fluid on herself before destroying the evidence and calling her supervisor to cry rape?

The defense would have been pilloried for presenting this as a possible reason for reasonable doubt as the above scenario seems so outrageous, but now, with the bloody sheet, the telephone call and the character flaws of the accuser, it does not seem so far-fetched at all.

It explains how the semen could get on her uniform without any contact with DSK, and the information comes from her. It may not be true, but it is plausible.

What a gift this report is for the defense.

had shady connections and a bank account with irregular cash deposits.
Answer (Meaning a person of little trust or non. not to mention stealing money from the government)

Crime lab results that show the semen of Mr. Strauss-Kahn was found on her clothing.
Answer (Really? You should se my clothes sometimes when I’m out with a little margarita)

In the moments after the encounter between Mr. Strauss-Kahn and the housekeeper, four employees at the Sofitel New York each spoke to her, one after the other, and each was convinced that she was “shook up” and “in distress,”

Answer (we are talking here about a female with as you wrote shady connections? .don’t you think al the time that she had spend with those shady connection she would have learned lots of tricks?)

Two former police officers who didn’t think she was making it up,”
Answer (so now we have in evidence peoples thinking .)

I could not be bothered reading any more of Mr Dwyers colum
Send him back to the Cartoon section
Regards themistoklis
agreed - Let the facts come out in Court.  Let the jury decide.
Both people should be returned to their original, home countries, and be banned from ever returning to the USA. Now.

This case should be tried in New York. If the case is dismissed, it would be easier for men to act violently against women and then not even have to stand trial. The case in France with the novelist who was raped by DSK should also be tried. What should be dismissed are the two defamation suits DSK's legal team are bringing against the women who have dared to speak up against a powerful man with no shame and an alleged penchant for violently humiliating women (I find it hard to believe that two women would independently fabricate two similar narratives about violence inflicted upon them by DSK). I wonder how many more women have suffered on account of his perversions and are too afraid to speak up. I find his actions, the response of the media, and the response of many people in France as well as the United States incredibly distressing. I am honestly surprised that so many male commenters in particular are apparently so quick to disrespectfully judge and blame the victim.

I don't know the answer to whether Mr. Strauss-Kahn ought to be tried in court as per the original plan of NYC prosecutors.

But I do know that this article omits crucial facts. While it is mentioned that the housekeeper lied about her past life, it is left unmentioned that she changed her account, in significant ways, of what happened during and after the encounter with Strauss-Kahn.

And while nothing is mentioned of the credentials of whoever it was that translated the telephone call with her boyfriend -- the call alleged to show her planning to exploit Strauss-Kahn for his money -- her *lawyer's* claim that the call was misinterpreted is mentioned.

(Whatever the case, it's pretty hard to get away with mistranslating a taped phone call, even if it is in an exotic dialect of a distant foreign language.)

By comparison, someone's lawyer's claim, in vacuo without being verified in any way, has about the same evidentiary value as the claim of a defendant's mother that they are innocent.

Finally: Can someone please clarify if this article is intended to be a) a news story, b) news analysis, or c) an opinion piece? Because there really is a diffence among these options, and it is an important one. (The heading "About New York" does not adequately answer this question.)

To all the commenters out there, including Mr. Dwyer, who purport to "speak for all New Yorkers" and are calling for a public airing of the events that occurred in Room 2820, the point of a trial is not to satiate your curiosity. This is about balancing the scales of justice between two people, the accuser and the accused, and not about quenching any voyeuristic need to know all the juicy details of what went on in that room.

Why would she be shook up after leaving the room. The DA's office has admitted she was seeing a parade of men where they were sheltering her. She is obviously a hooker. It would be like a roofer being shook up after fixing a broken shingle on a shed. Or a mechanic starting to panic at the sight of dirty air filter. Give me a break. Send the liar back home where she came from.

Bostoncarla

A complaint for attempted rape has now been filed in France by another alleged victim of DSK. Now we will see if French justice is able to do any better job than American justice. Don't hold your breath.

The only thing both of these cases prove is that even if DSK is exonerated on all charges, he remains what anyone who has watched his career already knew: He is a slimeball of the first order.

This case is certainly fascinating.

Previously I was of the opinion that the unreliability of the witness caused reasonable doubt, and that whether or not DSK is guilty is in a way irrelevant. I believed that the system as it is produces the best and most truthful results for the most people over time.

Now I just don't know anything, except that the case is not going away anytime soon.

I'm not understanding the breathless reporting about this case that I'm reading in the NY Times and the Washington Post. Is it the position of this paper that foreign citizens captured by our military should be Mirandized? I mean I know the elites at the NY Times are smart but they do realize the Constitution  is applicable only in the USA?

We are a nation of laws.
A suspect is assumed to be innocent until proven guilty.
If commenters would rather shoot/keelhaul/just plain old kill any suspect apprehended, they should think hard about leaving America. Here, we´re bound by the constitution, which abhors such fascist action.
THEN AGAIN..... Somali is code for Black. Terrorist is code for flag-burner. No wonder they´re all frothing at the mouth.
Memo to Nancy Grace:  No babe, this was all about you.
OMG! OMG! I totally didn't think she was going to get acquitted until season 2! Is that more than 140 characters?

Stopped watching Nancy Grace years ago because she hot air and doesn't give a rats tush if someone is not guilty under the evidence presented.   You can dislike Casey Anthony as much as I do from the little I have followed the case, which is less than a few hours told over the last three (?) years. But disliking someone doesn't make them guilty of the crime(s) charged. Personally I think these media trials are as bad as the mob rule public trials of past centuries/decades, which got people hung based on hysteria and not legal fact presented as evidience.

A "brilliant legal strategy" on the part of the defense team (????)......but what a sad state of affairs for the legal system in this country as well as the many murdered or abused children that have received no justice at the end of the day.
In the Casey Anthony trial, the defense team concocted a story which was designed to "create reasonable doubt". Both parents, George and Cindy, were involved in this game-like strategy, presented as "the defense". The defense team presented facts in this case to make George look like he was "the bad guy".......they said loudly that he sexually abused his daughter Casey and that he was having an adulterous affair with a woman he met while working with the search teams organized to find his grandaughter. During the trial, no one challenged (or elaborated) the sexual abuse charges...and that was by design.....the defense "knew" the prosecution would not touch that one, but they hoped the jury would "just have to think about that" and based on the other things that came up about him in court, they anticipated the jury would not find him believable. They also said that he was the one who disposed of Caylee's body in the woods. A ludicrous suggestion, but nevertheless, cast a cloud of suspicion on George. Casey's mother, Cindy, even went as far as trying to take the blame for the searches on the computer for things like chloroform etc. The defense team had to know that checking her work schedule against the schedule of "searches" would be the first thing the prosecution would check on (and discredit)......however, they did not believe that she would be brought up on perjury charges, and it was worth the risk to show her as a liar because that too took the suspicion from Casey. All of this was INTENTIONALLY done to throw a suspicion of doubt on Casey Anthony. AND, it worked. A brilliant defense strategy......but, is that the way we need to "play the game" in order to "win"!! Disgusting........

"Many Americans watched the Casey Anthony trial, then talked about it on Twitter and Facebook."

Many Americans need to get a life.

You're kidding, aren't you? Thousands of military men and women have died in Iraq and Afghanistan. No one has heard of them. But take a murder from the trailer park and suddenly everyone is watching 24/7. Nancy Grace is a national disGRACE - she pronounced the Duke LaCrosse team guilty as well, until the facts proved them innocent. Perhaps this jury knew much more than water-cooler gossip and irresponsible pundits.
Welcome to the eMob.

My guess is the $/student budget in these districts is plenty for a great school system.  The money just is not spent efficiently.  When there is a monopoly public school system, of course it becomes bloated and unworkable.  Los Angeles Unified District spends $30,000 per pupil.  Oh, it's a money shortage?  Yeah sure it is.  No, it is an education delivery problem.  (ie legally privileged elite govt workers who are unfireable).  The sad reality is, even $50,000 per child would not be enough.  Not with a broken, totally discredited public school system.  It simply isn't a money issue in the first place.  Public schools should not exist in the first place.  There is no need for them.  Let public funding be directed to schools based on merit -- and withdrawn from schools less efficient and effective than peers.

@12 victor: I would love to know the actual numbers to which you are referring. Your charter school is more in line with private sector pay. Does that mean it pays teachers more or less than public schools?
That's right give the Pakistani's 3.0 billion dollars but cut the budget for US citizen's health and education.  Dumb down the future of this country.

It's not about the money.  It's about getting back to basics.. basic math, reading, history, science, etc. skills.  It's about holding teacher's accountable.  It's about getting the government out of the classroom and returning the school districts back to the communities.  If we threw another 5 trillion dollars at the schools our kids would still graduate unable to read at a 3rd grade level and be unable to tell you who the first President of this country was.
